title: Sri Lanka GDP grows 3.7-pct in 2021, fourth quarter 1.8-pct
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s gross domestic product is estimated to have grown 3.7 percent in 2021 and the fourth quarter growth was 1.8 percent, the state statistics office said.
Agriculture grew 2.0 percent, industry 5.3 percent and services 3.0 percent as the economy recovered from a pandemic.
In the fourth quarter agriculture contracted 4.9 percent, industry 0.2 percent and services 3.8 percent.
Though Sri Lanka recovered from a Covid-19 pandemic large volumes of money were printed to keep rates down in a bid to create a ‘production economy’ generating forex shortages and reserve losses.
The International Monetary Fund has warned that the country could face monetary instability and import collapse in 2022 if money continued to be printed. (Colombo/Mar29/2022)
